page.title: 10Blythe Colours-Raw Materials
page.content: Blythe Colours, situated 7 miles south of Stoke-on-Trent in the village of Cresswell, makes colours. It's raw materials come from all over the world. There are more than 700 raw materials, examples of which are cobalt oxide from South Africa, chromium oxide from South America, copper oxide from South Africa and South America, cadmium metal from Japan and U.S.S.R., silica oxide from Norway, lead oxide from South America, China Clay and calcium both from England and Europe, tin oxide from Canada, zinc oxide from Sweden and the American Continent, gold, silver and platinum, all from South Africa, boron from America and Europe and zirconium from Australia and New Zealand.
